intro: Allionia subhispida, commonly known as the hairy allionia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to gardens. Allionia subhispida is also valued for its ability to tolerate drought conditions, making it a resilient choice for xeriscaping.
